intro: Oncodostigma mindorense, commonly known as the Mindanao oncobranch, is a flowering plant native to the Philippines. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae and is characterized by its small, clustered flowers and woody stems. The plant typically grows in tropical rainforests, thriving in humid and shaded environments. Its leaves are usually ovate to elliptical in shape, with a smooth or slightly hairy surface. Oncodostigma mindorense is of interest to botanists due to its unique morphology and limited distribution.
